title: type_as() to have better error message when fed with Variable
body_html:
Currently it makes a strange error message:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test.py", line 4, in <module>
    torch.eye(2).type_as(v)
  File ".../site-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 31, in type_as
    return self.type(tensor.type())
TypeError: type() takes exactly 2 arguments (1 given)

Example:

import torch

v = torch.autograd.Variable(torch.zeros(2))
torch.eye(2).type_as(v)

A crazy idea may be to have type_as create a Variable (this may be a non-verbose way to convert results of torch.* tensor creating functions to Variable). Otherwise, a nicer error message would be good.

body:
Currently it makes a strange error message:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test.py", line 4, in <module>
    torch.eye(2).type_as(v)
  File ".../site-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 31, in type_as
    return self.type(tensor.type())
TypeError: type() takes exactly 2 arguments (1 given)
```

Example:
```python
import torch

v = torch.autograd.Variable(torch.zeros(2))
torch.eye(2).type_as(v)
```

A crazy idea may be to have `type_as` create a `Variable` (this may be a non-verbose way to convert results of torch.* tensor creating functions to Variable). Otherwise, a nicer error message would be good.
